lines.text: Sometimes, Dolores... sometimes, you have to be a high-riding bitch to survive. Sometimes, being a bitch is all a woman has to hang onto.
Now, you listen to me, Mr. Grand High Poobah of Upper Buttcrack, I'm just about half-past give a shit with your fun and games.

Husbands die every day, Dolores. Why... one is probably dying right now while you're sitting here weeping. They die... and leave their wives their money. I should know, shouldn't I? Sometimes they're driving home from their mistress's apartment and their brakes suddenly fail. An accident, Dolores, can be an unhappy woman's best friend.

[to Joe]
That is the last time you ever hit me! Next time, one of us is going to the bone yard.
I did not murder that bitch any more than I'm wearing a diamond tiara.
If you say you're sorry one more time, I'll kick your butt up so high, you'll look like a hunchback.
Going on a morning walk?
No, I'm just packing the get-away boat, so I can make my great escape.
We're gonna sit down and have ourselves a drink! And after we're done - after *I'm* done, you can run upstairs and take whichever one of them little pills makes you feel the best.
It's a depressingly masculine world we live in, Dolores.
Don't we have a hair across our ass this morning, Dolores Claiborne?
Well, don't look to me, Dolores. All my money is tied up in cash.

[sobbing]
Why? Why'd you do this, Vera?
Because I hate the smell of being old.
I want my china pig!
Which one? There's only about two-hundred of 'em.

[Vera is ringing a bell]
Doloooress!...
Hell's bells. Look who's up.
I'm sorry, but I think it's for the best if you got yourself some legal representation.
You're sorry, are you? Bet the last time you were sorry was when you needed to use the pay toilet and the string on your pet dime broke.
If anyone is going to accuse me of killing my husband, go right ahead and call me Dolores!
It was just a bad patch.
I had a fucking nervous breakdown, mother!
Go ahead and take what you want. I ain't doin' any beauty pageants today.
Eighteen years ago, my father drank a bottle of scotch and fell down a well. Detective Mackey didn't think it was an accident, which is... why we're here today.
And what do you think, Selena?

I think I owe you an apology. I called you a son of a bitch. You said you thought we were a lot alike, and you were right. We both spent the past 18 years prosecuting this woman. We came out here- I know I did- believing she was guilty. We forgot this case is about Vera Donovan. Not my father.
And what if it wasn't an accident?

Look. It's been 18 years. I don't know what this has done to you, but let me tell you, it's consumed me. I have lived with this every day of my life. Every day. I was wrong and I won't do it anymore. And if I can say that, my God, can't you?

[Dolores is crying in front of Vera in the drawing room]
I insist that all women who have hysterics in my drawing room call me by my Christian name.
Look!
Hey Miss Claiborne!
Kill anyone else today?
Not just yet, when I change my mind I'll know exactly where to start
There is no Arizona.
What are you talking about, I never touched Selena!
Oh yeah? Well then how come you're making a face like the devil just reached down and grabbed those little raisins you call balls?
You must have boyfriends. Beautiful girl like you, smart and out in the world... You tellin' me there's nobody?
I'm telling you there's a *lot* of nobodies.
[Vera is not letting Dolores change her soiled sheets]
Vera, are ya gonna sit there and marinate in it? Come on!
Selena, we'd like her to stay at her house for the next few days.
If I decide to make my grand escape to South America, I'll be sure to let you know first.
I got another surprise for you, Joe.
What, did someone invent a pill to cure ugly?
Think what fun you'll have telling all your friends what a bitch Vera Donovan is!
I don't know how to feel about what you did... maybe I never will, Mom. But I know, I know you did it for me.
That is the last guy in the world you want to make an enemy out of.
I ain't makin' one, I'm KEEPIN' one.

[to her boss, Peter]
So not only are you not fucking me now, you're fucking me.

[to Selena, who is frantically taking pills]
How is that going to help?
Because in ten minutes, I'm gonna be fine.
Selena...
JUST GIVE ME TEN MINUTES!
If you wanna know what kind of life a person had, just look at their hands.

[to Dolores, who is hanging her sheets to dry]
Six pins, Dolores! Six pins, not five!
Don't you just love the Bossa Nova? I found them in New York and simply had to have them.

[noticing Vera's Phanny-Pan labeled as police evidence]
Jesus crow - you didn't even have the decency to clean up after her! You telling me this is evidence?

[when leaving her mother]
I'm sorry, Mother. Sometimes being a bitch is the only thing a woman has hold onto.

[referring to her mother's relationship with Vera Donovan]
These two women loved each other!
Go ahead Joe, Kill me. All I ask is that you do it quick, and don't let Selena see the mess once you're through.
Go ahead, Joe! All I ask is that you do it quick, and don't let Selena see the mess when it's over!
[Whispers]
You wanna run me down, go ahead. You can be as mean and hurtful as you want, but this is the last time you will ever hit me! You do it again, one of us is goin' to the boneyard!
Hell ain't somethin' you get thrown into overnight. Nope. Real hell comes on you slow and steady as a line of wet winter sheets.
